title: A number x is mistakenly divided by 10 instead of multiplied by 10. How to calculate the error in the result? - Quora

response.answer_text: A number x is mistakenly divided by 10 instead of multiplied by 10. How to calculate the error in the result? Let the number be 10 Number 10 on multiplication by 10 = 10 × 10 = 100 Number 10 is mistakenly divided by 10 instead of multiplication. On division the value will be 10 / 10 = 1 Error = 100 - 1 = 99 The value in place of 100, the error is 99, hence in percentage it will be 99% Error in result = 99 % Answer the error in result will be 99 %

A number x is mistakenly divided by 10 instead of multiplied by 10. How to calculate the error in the result? If the initial number is x and if it gets divided by 10, instead of getting multiplied by 10, what is supposed to be 10*x becomes x/10. When x*10 becomes x/10, 100 becomes 1 ((100/(x*10))*(x/10) = 1). When 100 becomes 1, this is straightaway an error of 99%.

Let x is the number to be multiplied by 10 = 10x when x is divided by 10 = x/10 The error = 10x - x/10 = (100x - x)/10 = 99x/10 The error in terms of percentage = [99x/10]*100/10x = 99% So, there will be 99% error in reporting.
